content: The problem is self-serving *certitude*. Obviously, the certitude that LGBT people are sinners to be avoided at all costs (and crushed, physically or emotionally, if still found in your midst) is a present (heinous) danger. But from my POV, the certitude that a different belief-system (say, one that has a Eternal, Benificent Will behind it?) is “deluded” offers just as great a threat in the long run. Speaking personally, I don’t want someone beating me, poisoning me, or electro-shocking me for saying I’m gay. But I don’t want them doing that for saying “I follow Jesus Christ” either! [See our friend Vladimir Putin (/s) as representative of someone who may well be doing the former practice — -anti “homosexual propaganda” law ‘n all — -now, but whose nation (the Soviet Union) did the latter, formerly.] The six magic (logical) words that will save us: “Of Course, I Could Be Wrong”.
